wrapScienceJ.metaData.container

Class MetaDataContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapScienceJ.metaData.container.MetaDataContainer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MetaData

    public class MetaDataContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows to represent a collection of parameters for use as input of a Generic Process. Each parameter has a fundamental type (String, float, double, int, boolean, choice in a list, etc.)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MetaDataContainer.UpdatePolicy
      The policy for managing and updating configs can be "overwrite": An existing config is overwritten if a new config is obtained; "Always ask": A new configuration is sought at each invocation without changing the default config (the GenericProcessConfig.duplicate() method can be used) "Always use default": No configuration input is sought at all and the configuration is taken as is, assumed to be "one size fits all"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String m_keyShortDescriptionForConfigFileName
      Unique short description for an attribute with type StringNoAttrib, the value of which is the configuration file name of the Generic Process Configuration.
      static java.lang.String m_keyShortDescriptionForTitle
      Unique short description for an attribute with type StringNoAttrib, the value of which is the title of the Generic Process Configuration.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MetaDataContainer()
      Allows to construct a config for a generic process with an empty collection of attribute data and no title or config file.

      Allows to construct a config for a generic process by concatenation of a collection of configs

      Allows to construct a config for a generic process with a collection of attribute data parsed from strings
      MetaDataContainer(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String configFileName)
      Allows to construct a config for a generic process with an empty collection of attribute data

    • Constructor Detail

      • MetaDataContainer

        public MetaDataContainer()
        Allows to construct a config for a generic process with an empty collection of attribute data and no title or config file.
        See Also:
        GenericProcessConcrete.getConfig()

      • MetaDataContainer

        public MetaDataContainer(java.lang.String title,
                         java.lang.String configFileName)
        Allows to construct a config for a generic process with an empty collection of attribute data
        Parameters:
        title - The short human readable title (e.g. for use as dialog box title)
        configFileName - The configuration file to be placed in a given directory The attribute list initially contains a StringNoAttrib with short description keyShortDescriptionForTitle and as value the title (e.g. to display in a dialog box); as well as a StringNoAttrib with short description "configFileNameDoNotUse" and as value the configFileName, to retrieve the configuration file if possible.

      • MetaDataContainer

        public MetaDataContainer(java.lang.String[] parsableStringRepresents,
                         java.lang.String title,
                         java.lang.String configFileName)
        Allows to construct a config for a generic process with a collection of attribute data parsed from strings
        Parameters:
        parsableStringRepresents - A collection of strings representing Attribute Characteristics.
        title - The short human readable title (e.g. for use as dialog box title)
        configFileName - The configuration file to be placed in a given directory
        See Also:
        AttributeData.AttributeData(String)

      • MetaDataContainer

        public MetaDataContainer(MetaDataContainer[] configs)
        Allows to construct a config for a generic process by concatenation of a collection of configs
        Parameters:
        configs - The configurations to concatenate

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        the number of attributes of the collection of parameters

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if the attributes of the collection of parameters contains only constant strings (i.e. contains only attributes with type AttributeType.StringNoAttrib)

      • setFileNameToDefault

        public boolean setFileNameToDefault()
        Sets the basename before the prefix to "default__", which is the prefix for a default file name.
        Returns:
        true if the file name has changed, false if left unchanged.

      • getAttribute

        public AttributeData getAttribute(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - position between 0 and (getSize()-1) of the attribute in the collection.
        Returns:
        changeable instance of the attribute.

      • setAttributeValue

        public void setAttributeValue(java.lang.String attribShortDescription,
                              java.lang.Object value)
        Allows to set a new value for an attribute present in the collection of attributes.
        Parameters:
        attribShortDescription - Short description of the attribute used as a unique key
        value - value to use as the new attribute's value

      • getAttribute

        public AttributeData getAttribute(java.lang.String attribShortDescription)
        Allows to set a new value for an attribute present in the collection of attributes.
        Parameters:
        attribShortDescription - Short description of the attribute used as a unique key
        Returns:
        The value of the attribute, if exists, null otherwise.

      • parseAttributeValue

        public void parseAttributeValue(java.lang.String parsableValueString)
        Allows to parse a new value for an attribute present in the collection of attributes.
        Parameters:
        parsableValueString - A string of the form "DDD:VVV", where DDD must be equal to this attribute short description and VVV must be a correct parsable value for the attribute type.

      • splitConfig

        public java.util.ArrayList<MetaDataContainer> splitConfig()
        Allows to split the different configurations corresponding to distinct files which can be contained in distinct configuration file, and possibly unrelalted parameters.
        Returns:
        The collection of individual configurations, each associated with one config file postfix.

      • addAttribute

        public MetaDataContainer addAttribute(AttributeData attributeData)
        Allows to add an attribute to a config for a generic process (using the cascade design pattern)
        Parameters:
        attributeData - the instance of AttributeData to add to the collection
        Returns:
        this instance for the cascade pattern

      • addAttribute

        public MetaDataContainer addAttribute(java.lang.String parsableStringRepresent)
        Allows to add an attribute to a config for a generic process by parsing a string. (using the cascade design pattern)
        Parameters:
        parsableStringRepresent - A string representing Attribute Characteristics.
        Returns:
        this instance for the cascade pattern
        See Also:
        AttributeData.AttributeData(String)

      • containsConfigWithTitle

        public boolean containsConfigWithTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Determines if an individual config with a given title is present in the configuration data.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the config to find
        Returns:
        true if a subconfig with that title is present in the config, false otherwise.
